    • clustering-based sample demultiplexing

    clustering-based sample demultiplexing

    Compiled: 2024-02-09

    clustering-based-demultiplexing.Rmd

    This vignette will provide an brief introduction on how to run a newly-developed Seurat-based workflow for de-multiplexing of scRNA-seq samples. This workflow takes as input tag counts matrix with tags as rows and cell IDs as columns and return sample-of-origin for each cell. This workflow is detailed as follows:

    1. Sequencing depth normalization using centered-log ratio (CLR) transformation
    2. uses graph clustering algorithm implemented using Seurat’s FindClusters function to group cells with similar tags profiles.
    3. for each cluster marker tags are identified using Seurat’s FindAllMarkers function.
    4. Cell assignment criteria
      • If a cluster have at least two markers, cells belong to this cluster are classified as doublets
      • If a cluster has only one marker, cells belong to this cluster are classified as singlets.
      • If a cluster has no marker, cells belong to this cluster are classified as negatives.

    Load necessary packages 

    library(Seurat)
library(ComplexHeatmap)
library(doParallel)
library(hashDemux)
library(dplyr)

    Download and load data 

    
download.file("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Oshlack/hashtag-demux-paper/main/data/BAL_data/batch3_c1_donors.csv",
    "ground_truth.csv")

download.file("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Oshlack/hashtag-demux-paper/main/data/BAL_data/batch3_c1_hto_counts.csv",
    "hto_counts.csv")

# tags IDs and their corresponding donor IDs
# https://github.com/Oshlack/hashtag-demux-paper/blob/main/analysis/BAL_analysis.Rmd
HTO_donor_list_batch3 <- list(`BAL 17` = "BAL Q", `BAL 18` = "BAL R", `BAL 19` = "BAL S", `BAL 20` = "BAL T",
    `BAL 21` = "BAL U", `BAL 22` = "BAL V", `BAL 23` = "BAL W", `BAL 24` = "BAL X", Doublet = "Doublet",
    Negative = "Negative")

ground_truth = read.csv("ground_truth.csv", header = T, row.names = 1)
rownames(ground_truth) = ground_truth$Barcode
table(ground_truth$genetic_donor)
#> 
#>    BAL Q    BAL R    BAL S    BAL T    BAL U    BAL V    BAL W    BAL X 
#>     1431     1234     3010     3769     2085     2050     5859     5345 
#>  Doublet Negative 
#>     5960      488

hto_counts = read.csv("hto_counts.csv", header = T, row.names = 1)
rownames(hto_counts) = HTO_donor_list_batch3[rownames(hto_counts)]

    create Seurat object 

    seurat_object = CreateSeuratObject(counts = hto_counts, assay = "HTO", names.delim = "")
seurat_object
#> An object of class Seurat 
#> 8 features across 31231 samples within 1 assay 
#> Active assay: HTO (8 features, 0 variable features)
#>  1 layer present: counts

seurat_object$ground_truth = ground_truth$genetic_donor

# downsample dataset
seurat_object <- seurat_object[, sample(colnames(seurat_object), size = ncol(seurat_object)/10,
    replace = F)]

    generate UMAP plot 

    assay = "HTO"
seurat_object = seurat_object %>%
    NormalizeData(assay = assay, normalization.method = "CLR", margin = 2)
seurat_object = seurat_object %>%
    ScaleData()
seurat_object = seurat_object %>%
    RunPCA(features = rownames(seurat_object[[assay]]), npcs = nrow(seurat_object[[assay]]) - 1)
seurat_object = seurat_object %>%
    RunUMAP(dims = 1:(nrow(seurat_object[[assay]]) - 1), seed.use = 1)

FeaturePlot(seurat_object, features = rownames(seurat_object), max.cutoff = "q95", min.cutoff = "q5",
    ncol = 4)

    
DimPlot(seurat_object, group.by = "ground_truth")

    clustering-based demultiplexing 

    seurat_object = clustering_based_demux(seurat_object, assay = "HTO")

# table(seurat_object$classification)
seurat_object$clustering_based = seurat_object$sampleBC
seurat_object$clustering_based[seurat_object$classification == "Doublet"] = "Doublet"


DimPlot(seurat_object, group.by = "classification")

    DimPlot(seurat_object, group.by = "clustering_based", label = T)

    
DimPlot(seurat_object, group.by = "clustering_based", label = T) + DimPlot(seurat_object, group.by = "ground_truth",
    label = T)

    comparison with HTOdemux 

    seurat_object = seurat_object %>%
    NormalizeData(assay = assay, normalization.method = "CLR", margin = 1)
seurat_object = HTODemux(seurat_object)
seurat_object$HTOdemux = seurat_object$hash.ID

seurat_object$HTOdemux = factor(seurat_object$HTOdemux, levels = sort(levels(seurat_object$HTOdemux)))
DimPlot(seurat_object, group.by = "HTOdemux") + DimPlot(seurat_object, group.by = "clustering_based") +
    DimPlot(seurat_object, group.by = "ground_truth")

    

col_fun = circlize::colorRamp2(breaks = c(0, 0.5, 1), colors = c("lightgray", "yellow", "red"),
    reverse = F)

mtrx = table(seurat_object$ground_truth, seurat_object$clustering_based) %>%
    as.matrix()
mtrx2 = apply(mtrx, MARGIN = 1, FUN = function(x) x/sum(x)) %>%
    t()

cluster_heatmap = Heatmap(mtrx2, cluster_columns = F, cluster_rows = F, col = col_fun, row_title = "Ground Truth",
    column_title_side = "bottom", column_title = "Predicted label (Clustering-based)", name = "Proportion of cells",
    show_heatmap_legend = F, cell_fun = function(j, i, x, y, width, height, fill) {
        grid.text(sprintf("%d", mtrx[i, j]), x, y, gp = gpar(fontsize = 10))
    }, row_names_side = "left", column_names_side = "top")

mtrx = table(seurat_object$ground_truth, seurat_object$HTOdemux) %>%
    as.matrix()
mtrx2 = apply(mtrx, MARGIN = 1, FUN = function(x) x/sum(x)) %>%
    t()

htodemux_heatmap = Heatmap(mtrx2, cluster_columns = F, cluster_rows = F, col = col_fun, row_title = "Ground Truth",
    column_title_side = "bottom", column_title = "Predicted label (HTOdemux)", name = "Proportion of cells2",
    show_heatmap_legend = F, cell_fun = function(j, i, x, y, width, height, fill) {
        grid.text(sprintf("%d", mtrx[i, j]), x, y, gp = gpar(fontsize = 10))
    }, row_names_side = "left", column_names_side = "top")

htodemux_heatmap + cluster_heatmap
